enhanced_by.reason: Both methods involve state changes related to the value and its presence, which can be used to set up test scenarios.
The ifPresent method can be used to set up the state of the object before calling toString, ensuring the object is in a valid state for the test.
The toString method uses DeferredLogger.logValue to format the value, making it a direct source for assertions on the output of toString.
Both toString methods produce string representations of their respective states, allowing for cross-verification of output formats.
